intro: Gomphostemma viride, commonly known as green gomphostemma, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Gomphostemma viride is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
